title: I no longer have the bookmarks/history
content:
Hello,

I no longer have the bookmarks/history in the Firefox profile. Currently there are 2 profiles and neither of them has the lost info. I recently installed new version of windows and then connected to firefox but the bookmarks didn't show. Is there anyway that there can be done a restore from cloud to my account (restore date - 12-21-2021)Â ?
creator: ctk_stefan

title: Location
content: Whenever I access a website, it locates me in Canada. This has been going on for a few months. I've tried to fix it - have browsed and googled to no avail. Even Firefox thinks I am in Canada. How did this happen? How can I fix it?
creator: skywavewriters

title: Firefox gone after Windows 10 update - now have a /Mozilla Firefox.bak/ folder - how I get FF back running?
content:
Firefox was gone this morning after an auto Windows 10 update. Now have a /Mozilla Firefox.bak/ folder - how I get FF back running?

For safety reasons I didn't touch anything yet, hope I can restore the previous session.
creator: yello1

title: Windows 11 - fresh install; menu button and all buttons on same row open, then vanish and can't be clicked on
content: Just booted up a new laptop with Win11 and installed Firefox - had been working normally, but now I can't get back into the browser menu or anything else on that menu/url bar. On opening a new window, I can click and view the menu, but within a few seconds it vanishes, but the button remains highlighted as though it's still open, so I can't re-open it.
creator: kem5242

title: NO longin box on website I subscribe to
content:
I subscribe to a publication called Nikkei Asia. Their site is asia.nikkei.com.

I get regular e-mails from them with headlines. If I click on these to 'READ MORE' I cannot because the login box doesn't appear.

To access the content of the publication I have to log in, using the login box that appears on the first page of the site. BUT using Firefox, which is my regular, default browser NO login box appears.

If I use another browser (e.g. Safari) the login box appears automatically.

So what's the problem. This is an important news site for me so if I can't solve this, I will probably switch my default browser to Safari.

Any idea what's wrong?
creator: rbmcarthur
